docs.text: How to Use ¶ How to use/add to this resource Git/Github ¶ Setting up Git ¶ Go to https://sourceforge.net/projects/git-osx-installer/files/git-2.33.0-intel-universal-mavericks.dmg/download?use_mirror=autoselect The download should automatically start Run these two commands in your terminal, adding your name and email where needed. git config --global user.name "John Doe" git config --global user.email johndoe@example.co With that, you should have git fully set up. Setting up a GitHub account ¶ Go here and make an account: https://github.com/join That's it. Watch this video for an excellent example of how to use git & GitHub. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DVRQoVRzMIY Clone the Repository ¶ Go to this repository on github Click the green "code" button and copy the url Run these commands in the directory you want to have the code in To change the working directory use the cd command. Ex: cd desktop git clone https://github.com/201-991-Broncobotics/broncobotics-knowledge.git (this is the url you copied) 5. git checkout main You should be ready to edit the code in it Obsidian ¶ A markdown editor to edit files and upload the Install it on your computer Open the docs folder of the code that you cloned as a vault Go to Settings -> Community Plugins -> Community Plugins/Browse Search for Obsidian Git -> Install it Scroll to the bottom of the community plugins tag and enable it Make changes on the files Push your changes and it should work
docs.title: How to Use

docs.text: Go to this repository on github Click the green "code" button and copy the url Run these commands in the directory you want to have the code in To change the working directory use the cd command. Ex: cd desktop git clone https://github.com/201-991-Broncobotics/broncobotics-knowledge.git (this is the url you copied) 5. git checkout main You should be ready to edit the code in it

docs.text: A markdown editor to edit files and upload the Install it on your computer Open the docs folder of the code that you cloned as a vault Go to Settings -> Community Plugins -> Community Plugins/Browse Search for Obsidian Git -> Install it Scroll to the bottom of the community plugins tag and enable it Make changes on the files Push your changes and it should work

docs.text: FTC Links ¶ Internal Resources ¶ How to Use ExternalWebsites ¶ CAD ¶ https://learn.onshape.com/learning-paths/introduction-to-cad Design ¶ https://www.firstinspires.org/sites/default/files/uploads/resource_library/ftc/legal-illegal-parts-list.pdf legal parts list https://www.mcmaster.com/ https://www.gobilda.com/ Gobilda has user guides for how to use their parts. Additionally, their parts have layouts and schematics for ways that they are intended to be used. https://gm0.org/en/latest/ Great resource for almost anything FTC-related https://gm0.org/en/latest/docs/useful-resources.html https://www.nycfirst.org/ftc-resources A ton of links to design resources on design, wiring, cad, etc. https://ftctutorials.com/en/Robot.html A lot of overlap with the links above https://www.chiefdelphi.com/c/other/first-tech-challenge/60 Forum website where people ask questions related to FTC and FRC robotics. https://www.firstinspires.org/resource-library/ftc/robot-building-resources FIRST official resources https://www.projectb.net.au/resources/robot-mechanisms/ Mainly for FRC but fantastic anyways- https://robotics.nasa.gov/downloads/nasarap-rdc-v101-compressed.pdf Also mainly FRC but really good
docs.title: FTC Links

docs.title: Design

docs.text: Packing List ¶ Stuff to Bring: Clothes Comfortable clothes, no need for brophy dress code, but dress appropriately Extra socks, extra underwear, etc (be prepared) Temperatures will be close to Flagstaff weather (chilly) Bring a light sweater Sleeping Materials Sleeping Bag Pillow Blanket(if you want, it won't be too cold) Toiletries Towel for showers Toothbrush Toothpaste Deoderant Shampoo & Body Wash Any medication that you might need Others: Closed toed shoes for hiking Reusable water bottle Snacks Nintendo switch and/or controllers Don't plan to bring a big console like an xbox, but something portable is good
docs.title: Packing List
